title: Instructional Design Scenarios for Online Collaborative Argumentation and Self-Regulated Learning Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic argumentation structures and familiarity with fundamental self-regulated learning concepts
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning using digital whiteboards in a BYOD environment. Focuses on argumentation structure analysis and self-regulated learning strategies for scientific problem-solving.

learning_goals: Learners can write structured argumentation reports on scientific topics using Toulmin Argumentation Pattern (TAP) and Vee Diagram (AVD)
Learners can manage argumentation processes by applying self-regulation (self/co-regulatory/social regulation) strategies in online whiteboard collaboration environments
Learners can demonstrate collaborative problem-solving skills by identifying and improving logical flaws in argument structures through peer feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
